dnd5e-spellpoints.form: Click the button to open Spell Points System 5e Configuration
dnd5e-spellpoints.legacyMode: This mod now creates a custom resource tracking so as to not take up one of your 3 resource trackers. Activate this if you prefer to keep using a resource tracker.
dnd5e-spellpoints.form-hint: Here you can configure module behaviour, spell point cost and more.
dnd5e-spellpoints.resourceNote: This is the name of the resource on Player Character Sheet that represents the spell points (default: Spell Points).
dnd5e-spellpoints.mixedMode: Allow player to choose whether to use Spellpoints.
dnd5e-spellpoints.autoNote: Enable this settings if you want the module do the math for you every time a Player Character advance in a Class Level or gain a new Class
dnd5e-spellpoints.formulaNote: What formula should this module use to calculate the maximum PC spell points (default: DMG).
dnd5e-spellpoints.formulaNote2: Choosing Advanced Magic (homebrew), spell points will be calculated accordingly to the free homebrew module "Advanced Magic - Spell Points System 5e" available for free on
dnd5e-spellpoints.costLabel: Spell Points cost for Level {slotLevel} slots.
dnd5e-spellpoints.spellPointsCostsNote: You don't need to change the spell point costs if you are using the default spellpoint rules on DMG (page 288).
dnd5e-spellpoints.AMInstructions: This module allows you to customize spellpoints costs and enabling other options below not used with the default rules. You can find an alternate system available for free on
dnd5e-spellpoints.AMInstructions2: the options you see below are part of the rules explained in that module.
dnd5e-spellpoints.enableVariantLabel: Use HP as Spell Points (Gritty Variant)
dnd5e-spellpoints.enableVariantNote: Enabling this Player's Characters will be able to continue casting spell once they run out of spell points using their own life at increased cost (see Advanced Magic System)
dnd5e-spellpoints.spLifeCostNote: How many Hit Points Maximum a character will lose casting a spell with their own life. This is a multiplier. ex: if set to 2 a character casting a Spell with a cost of 2 spell points will lose 4 hp max. (default:2)
dnd5e-spellpoints.use-spellpoints-note: Character will use spell points instead of spell slots.
dnd5e-spellpoints.spellpoints-modifier-n: Will reduce or add to amount of spell points used on every cast.
dnd5e-spellpoints.createNewResource: Please create a new resource named {SpellPoints}
dnd5e-spellpoints.castedLifeDead: {ActorName} cast using their life, their Hit Points Maximum reached 0 and DIED permanently!
dnd5e-spellpoints.castedLife: {ActorName} cast using their own life losing {hpMaxLost} Maximum Hit Points
dnd5e-spellpoints.notEnoughSp: {ActorName} doesn't have enough {SpellPoints} to cast this spell.
dnd5e-spellpoints.pleaseCreate: Please create a resource named: '{SpellPoints}' to cast this spell.
dnd5e-spellpoints.youNotEnough: You don't have enough '{SpellPoints}' to cast this spell.
dnd5e-spellpoints.formulaBaseNote: The base formula is added if the character has at least one spell slot.
dnd5e-spellpoints.formulaSlotNote: The slot formula multiplies the total Spell Point costs of the slots that the character would have.
dnd5e-spellpoints.warlockUseSpNote: By default warlocks cannot use the spellpoints system, enabling this they will be able to do it like other casters.
dnd5e-spellpoints.chatMessagePrivateNote: Enabling this setting the chat messages about how many Spell Points have been used, will be visible by the GM and the current player, other players will not see the message.
